comments:
The wizard asks for a display name although I have written one. The "Next"
buttom refuses to activate.

The environment is WTP 1.0M3, Eclipse 3.1M5a. All Jars etc according to WTP
instalation guidlines. I was following the tutorial: WTP Tutorials - Building a
Simple EJB Application, with the only difference in using WebLogic 8.1 instead
of the suggested JBoss. I don't think that is the cause for the error though.

The Eclipse log lists this error:

(In reply to comment #0) 
> The wizard asks for a display name although I have written one. The "Next" 
> buttom refuses to activate. 
>  
> The environment is WTP 1.0M3, Eclipse 3.1M5a. All Jars etc according to WTP 
> instalation guidlines. I was following the tutorial: WTP Tutorials - 
Building a 
> Simple EJB Application, with the only difference in using WebLogic 8.1 
instead 
> of the suggested JBoss. I don't think that is the cause for the error 
though. 
>  
<snipped> 
 
G'Day all, 
	I have the same error message in the same tutorial when running 
against JBoss 3.2.3. It occurs under WinME. All required files have been 
downloaded and installed. The tutorial has been followed exactly. 
 
	Under Linux, I cannot get past the Create EJB wizard, as it give the 
same error under the Name field ("Names cannot be empty")
Should be fixed in the latest drops

This bug is related to XML validation.  The validator cannot access xsd/dtd to
validate due to lack of internet connection.

-Either dowload and add them to catalogs 

The issue is known and being fixed.  Validators will cache the dtds/xsds after
the first access.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
